lexUnit.name: vow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: solemnly promise to do something.

sentence.text: I silently vowed I would not be returning to Coldstream .
The killing , in Cookstown , County Tyrone , comes a week after the I R A vowed revenge for the murder of the Sien Fein activists in the town .
However , Jim vowed revenge next season -- if he still has anything to do with the handicapping !
Mazowiecki 's government had earlier vowed to end monopolistic practices and state subsidies for parties .
Last night Tom McGovern , a member the yard 's industrial committee , vowed to fight any enforced redundancies .
He won their favour in the wake of last year 's Anita Hill case when he vowed to clamp down on sexual discrimination and harassment in the workplace .
And yesterday he vowed : ` If I am appointed , I shall be doing things in a somewhat different style .
But he vowed : ` I 'll battle through -- I 've been a fighter all my life . "
One fan vowed : ` I 'll picket every home game . "
She had vowed never to give way to that .
MP Keith Vaz last night vowed the campaign to compensate victims of the BCCI collapse will continue , after emerging from talks with Economic Secretary Anthony Nelson .
The Bank Action Group has vowed to take up Mr Stoller 's case .
He remembers hearing it said that each man in one gang at least vowed to kill or disable the keepers if they attempted to thwart their attacks on the game .
Some businesses vowed they would be back today and a number of ` business as usual " signs had already gone up around shop windows .
They vowed his form would improve if he quit Arsenal and returned to Glasgow .
She vowed that never would she resort to such cheap tricks .
I did it , though I vowed I would never work that fast again . "
He vowed he himself would lead a return to Whitechapel on the morrow .
He has vowed not to miss a moment of the children 's formulative years .
I vowed that my brothers would never go hungry . "
But she has vowed to be there on Sunday .
` One day I 'm going to be famous , too , " she vowed silently .
He vowed that no hint of scandal would ever be attached to him .
He vowed that when they returned in the summer he would take her for a holiday .
